clinical_study.brief_title: Echocardiography Examination Of The Cardiac Effects Of Different Regional Anesthesia Methods
clinical_study.official_title: Echocardiographic Investigation of the Cardiac Effects of Different Regional Anesthesia Methods Used in Intertrochanteric Femoral Fracture Operations

lead_sponsor.agency: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Nerve blocks applied with neuraxial anesthesia and ultrasonography are used for many operations today. Neuraxial blocks cause varying degrees of decrease in the blood pressure level of the patients. Peripheral blocks may be preferred to avoid the cardiac effects of the neuraxial anesthesia method.

detailed_description.textblock:
The hypothesis of this study was that spinal anesthesia applied in intertrochanteric femoral fracture operations caused hypotension by lowering the cardiac ejection fraction.
In our study, The investigators aimed to find out the effect of different regional anesthesia methods on the cardiac function of the patients by echocardiography.

primary_outcome.description: Ejection fraction (EF) measurement will be made with Simpson's method and fractional shortening method.

secondary_outcome.description: systolic, diastolic and median blood pressure values
The echocardiogram will measure the flow velocity between the left atrium and ventricle in cm/s in pulsed wave mode and the E/A ratio will be calculated.
Depth of anesthesia will be measured by placing Entropy sensors on the forehead as needed.
The drugs used for sedation and their amounts will be recorded.

intervention.description: Transthoracic echocardiogram will be performed before the operation and at certain time intervals during the operation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 60-100 years old
- American Society of Anesthesiologist Score I-IV
Exclusion Criteria:
- Local anesthetic allergy
- Bleeding disorder
- Mental disorder
- Allergy to drugs used
- Body mass index above 30
